title: Academic Research Instrument Response Bias Detector
description: Upload your survey or experimental response data and instrument metadata to automatically detect common response biases such as acquiescence, social desirability, and extreme responding. Receive a structured report with statistical evidence, simple visualizations, and actionable recommendations to improve your data quality and instrument design.
inputLabel: Upload your raw response data file (CSV or Excel) and instrument metadata JSON
outputLabel: Bias detection report with statistical insights, visualizations, and recommendations
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant specializing in detecting response biases in social science and psychology research instruments. Given raw survey or experimental response data files (CSV or Excel) and instrument metadata, analyze the data to identify common response biases such as acquiescence bias, social desirability bias, and extreme responding. Generate a clear, structured text report highlighting detected bias patterns with supporting statistical evidence. Include simple textual visualizations of response distributions and bias indicators per instrument section or item. Provide actionable recommendations for mitigating bias impact in data analysis or instrument revision. Enforce strict data privacy: do not store or expose any participant-identifiable information. Reject inputs missing required fields or unsupported formats with clear error messages. Refuse any request attempting medical, legal, or diagnostic interpretation. Output only plain text unless structured-output is enabled, then produce valid JSON with biasMetrics, visualizationData, and recommendations fields. Always keep the user informed of any validation or processing issues. Use a professional, academic tone suitable for social science researchers.

presets.label: Summary Report
presets.prompt: Analyze the uploaded survey response data and instrument metadata to detect common response biases. Provide a concise summary report highlighting key bias patterns, statistical evidence, and practical recommendations for researchers.
presets.hint: Get a brief overview focusing on main biases and recommendations.

presets.label: Detailed Statistical Analysis
presets.prompt: Perform a thorough statistical analysis of the uploaded response data to identify acquiescence bias, social desirability bias, and extreme responding. Include detailed bias metrics, confidence levels, and interpretive commentary suitable for academic reporting.
presets.hint: Request an in-depth, data-driven analysis with interpretive detail.

presets.label: Visualizations Overview
presets.prompt: Generate textual visualizations and descriptions of response distributions and bias indicators by instrument section and item based on the uploaded data and metadata. Highlight areas of concern for further investigation.
presets.hint: Focus on visual insights in text form to understand bias patterns.

presets.label: Recommendations Focus
presets.prompt: Provide actionable recommendations for mitigating detected response biases in data analysis and instrument redesign. Base recommendations on the uploaded dataset's bias detection results and best practices in social science research.
presets.hint: Emphasize practical steps researchers can take to improve data validity.

jsonSchemaHint: When structured-output is enabled, output JSON with keys: biasMetrics (object), visualizationData (object), recommendations (array of strings).
clarifyPrompt: Please upload your survey or experimental response data file (CSV or Excel) and instrument metadata (JSON). Ensure the files contain required columns and metadata fields. If unsure, ask for assistance or instructions.
finalizePrompt: Review the bias detection report carefully. Use the recommendations to improve your data analysis or instrument design. Remember, this tool aids in identifying response biases but final validation decisions remain yours. For deeper analysis or dashboard exploration, consider advanced multi-page versions later.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Instrument Response Bias Detector

niche.role: Academic Researcher in Social Sciences or Psychology
niche.scenario: Analyzing survey or experimental instrument response data to detect and report potential systematic response biases affecting data validity

idea.problem: Researchers often struggle to identify subtle but impactful response biases (e.g., acquiescence bias, social desirability bias, extreme responding) in their survey or experimental data, which can compromise the validity and reliability of their findings. Existing tools focus on data cleaning or psychometric validation but lack automated, interpretable detection of common response biases from raw response patterns.
inputs: Raw survey or instrument response data (CSV or Excel format)
Instrument metadata (question types, scales, reverse-coded items)
outputs: Structured report highlighting detected response bias patterns with statistical evidence
Visualizations of response distributions and bias indicators per instrument section or item
Recommendations for mitigating bias impact in data analysis or instrument revision
whyItWins: Fills a gap by providing automated, interpretable response bias detection tailored to social science and psychology instruments
Supports early detection of problematic response patterns, improving data quality and research validity
Outputs actionable recommendations, helping researchers decide on data adjustments or instrument redesign
Lightweight initial input/output enables quick insights, but with rich potential for deeper multi-page analytics and integration

upgradePath.today: Single-page app where researchers upload response data and instrument metadata to get a downloadable bias detection report and simple visualizations
upgradePath.in90Days: Multi-page system adding interactive dashboards to explore bias patterns by demographic groups, item clusters, and time; exportable summary tables; integration with psychometric validation tools
upgradePath.in12Months: Full research instrument quality management platform including longitudinal tracking of response biases across studies, collaborative annotation and instrument revision workflows, and predictive bias risk modeling using machine learning

riskNotes: Ensure no sensitive participant-identifiable data is exposed or stored insecurely
Avoid medical, legal, or diagnostic interpretations; focus strictly on data quality insights
Require clear disclaimers that tool aids data exploration but final validity judgments rest with researchers

blueprint.summary: A research tool for academic social scientists and psychologists to upload survey response data and instrument metadata, automatically detect common response biases with interpretable statistical evidence, visualize bias patterns, and receive actionable recommendations to improve data quality and instrument design.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic researchers in social sciences or psychology analyzing survey or experimental instrument data
successMetrics: Number of bias detection reports generated
User engagement with interactive dashboards and visualizations
User-reported improvements in data quality or instrument revision decisions
Frequency of exported reports and summary tables
Adoption rate of integration features with psychometric tools

components.name: Data Upload & Input UI
components.responsibility: Allow users to upload raw response data files, instrument metadata, and optional demographic data; validate inputs and provide feedback.
notes: Support CSV and Excel formats with clear instructions.
Validate file structure and required fields before processing.

components.name: Bias Detection API
components.responsibility: Process uploaded data to detect response biases using statistical algorithms; generate structured bias reports and visualization data.
notes: Implement algorithms for common biases: acquiescence, social desirability, extreme responding.
Return interpretable results with statistical evidence and confidence metrics.
Handle malformed or incomplete data gracefully.

components.name: Bias Report & Visualization UI
components.responsibility: Display bias detection results in structured reports with charts and visualizations; allow users to download reports and explore bias patterns interactively.
notes: Include visualizations per instrument section and item.
Provide actionable recommendations based on detected biases.
Support export of reports in PDF or CSV.

components.name: Data Storage & Persistence
components.responsibility: Persist user-uploaded metadata, analysis results, and user settings securely; ensure no sensitive participant-identifiable data is stored long-term unless explicitly permitted.
notes: Implement data retention policies to avoid storing sensitive raw participant data.
Store only aggregated or anonymized results for dashboards and history.

components.name: Interactive Dashboard UI
components.responsibility: Provide multi-page dashboards for exploring bias patterns by demographics, item clusters, and time; enable filtering, sorting, and exporting summary tables.
notes: Supports advanced exploration beyond initial report.

components.name: Psychometric Tools Integration
components.responsibility: Integrate with external psychometric validation tools to enhance bias detection and instrument quality assessment.
notes: Use APIs or data exchange formats to connect with popular psychometric software.
Plan for future machine learning bias risk modeling.

components.name: Background Report Generation Job
components.responsibility: Asynchronously generate downloadable bias detection reports and visualizations after data processing to improve UI responsiveness.
notes: Handle large datasets and retry on failures.
Notify users on job completion or errors.

edgeCases: Uploaded files with missing or inconsistent metadata fields
Malformed or corrupted CSV/Excel files causing parsing failures
Datasets with very small sample sizes limiting statistical power
Instruments with mixed question types or non-standard scales
Demographic data missing or incomplete for subgroup analyses
User uploads containing sensitive participant identifiers requiring immediate deletion
Bias detection algorithms returning inconclusive or contradictory results
Simultaneous multiple uploads causing processing queue delays
User attempts to access reports or dashboards without proper authorization
nonGoals: Providing medical, legal, or diagnostic interpretations of participant data
Storing or exposing raw participant-identifiable data beyond transient processing
Replacing expert psychometric validation or comprehensive instrument design
Real-time collaborative editing or annotation in initial versions
Machine learning predictive bias modeling in initial release (planned for future)

dataFlow: User authenticates and navigates to /upload page.
User uploads CSV/Excel files and metadata via /upload UI.
Frontend validates file formats and required fields; provides immediate feedback.
Frontend sends files and metadata to POST /api/upload.
API validates file structure, stores metadata in UploadedDataset with status 'uploaded' or 'error'.
Upon successful upload, user triggers bias detection via POST /api/bias-detection/start with uploadId.
API enqueues BiasDetectionProcessing background job with uploadId.
BiasDetectionProcessing job fetches uploaded data, runs bias detection algorithms, generates biasMetrics, visualizationData, and recommendations.
Job stores results in BiasReport linked to UploadedDataset; updates status.
ReportGeneration job triggers after BiasDetectionProcessing completes to create downloadable PDF/CSV reports and visualization assets.
User accesses /report/:reportId page; frontend fetches report data from GET /api/report/:reportId.
User explores interactive visualizations and recommendations; can download reports.
User accesses /dashboard page; frontend requests aggregated dashboard data via GET /api/dashboard/data with filters.
Dashboard displays interactive charts and summary tables based on aggregated, anonymized data.
User can save preferences via POST /api/user/settings; preferences stored in UserSettings.
DataRetentionCleanup job runs monthly to anonymize or delete sensitive raw data per policy.
validationRules: Upload UI: Accept only CSV or Excel files; reject unsupported formats.
Uploaded files must contain required columns as per instrument metadata schema.
Metadata fields must include instrument identifiers and demographics if provided.
Reject uploads with missing mandatory metadata or malformed files with clear error messages.
Bias detection API validates that uploadId exists, belongs to user, and upload status is 'uploaded'.
Bias detection algorithms validate dataset size to ensure statistical power; warn if too small.
Report API validates reportId exists and belongs to requesting user.
Dashboard API validates filter criteria format and permissible values.
User settings API validates preferences JSON schema before saving.
All APIs enforce authentication and authorization checks.
errorHandling: Upload API returns status 'error' with array of descriptive error messages on validation failure.
Bias detection start API returns error if uploadId invalid or processing already running.
Background jobs log errors and retry up to configurable limits; notify users on persistent failures.
Report and dashboard APIs return 404 if resource not found or unauthorized access.
Malformed requests return 400 with validation error details.
Unexpected server errors return 500 with generic message; detailed logs kept server-side.
UI displays user-friendly error messages and guidance for corrective actions.
Concurrent upload attempts queue and throttle to prevent overload.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication; verify user owns requested resources.
Sanitize and validate all uploaded files to prevent injection or malware.
Do not store raw participant-identifiable data beyond transient processing; delete or anonymize promptly.
Use secure storage for files and database with encryption at rest and in transit.
Implement rate limiting on upload and processing endpoints to prevent abuse.
Background jobs run with least privilege access to data.
Ensure CORS policies restrict API access to authorized frontends.
Log access and errors for audit and anomaly detection.
